net.metro.analyze

Class LineEdit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • net.metro.analyze.LineEdit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants, MarkerListener

    public class LineEdit
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements MarkerListener
    Frame that allows for the editing of route data including the route numbers, route paths, and route waypoints and stops. It cannot edit data on the service level, and any changes in data for these data types must be made from outside MASS and re-imported.
    Author:
    Sean Harger
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void addWayPoint()
      Adds a WayPoint to the currently selected route path and shows a corresponding WayPointEdit dialog to edit it.
      private void deleteRoute()
      Deletes the currently selected route from the SystemObjects database.
      private void deleteRoutePath()
      Deletes the selected route path from the selected route in the SystemObjects database.
      private void deleteWayPoint()
      Deletes the currently selected waypoint from the selected route path.
      void dispose()
      Disposes the LineEditFrame by clearing all selected RoutePaths that may have been selected from the editor and removing the MarkerListener placed on the SystemMap used to listen to user marker selection events.
      private void editRoute()
      Creates a RouteEdit dialog to edit the selected route.
      private void editRoutePath()
      Creates a RoutePathEdit dialog to edit the currently selected route path.
      private void editWayPoint()
      Creates a WayPointEdit dialog to edit the currently selected waypoint.

    • Method Detail

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes the LineEditFrame by clearing all selected RoutePaths that may have been selected from the editor and removing the MarkerListener placed on the SystemMap used to listen to user marker selection events.
        Overrides:
        dispose in class java.awt.Window

        the selected WayPoint from the waypoints list.

      • selectWayPoint

        protected void selectWayPoint(WayPoint wpt)
        Selects the specified WayPoint in the waypoints list. If the specified waypoint is not a member of the currently selected Route or RoutePath, then those combo box selections are changed to the appropriate values for th specified waypoint.
        Parameters:
        wpt - WayPoint desired to be selected.

      • updateRouteComboBox

        protected void updateRouteComboBox()
        Updates the routes combo box according to the routes within the SystemObjects database. It is typically called when the LineEdit frame is invoked and when the user adds a route to the database manually.

      • updatePathComboBox

        protected void updatePathComboBox()
        Updates the route paths combo box according to the route paths associated with the selected route in the route combo box. If no route is selected, then the list remains empty. This is typically called after a user makes a selection in the routes combo box or when a user adds a route path to the database manually.

      • updateWayPointList

        protected void updateWayPointList()
        Updates the waypoint list according to the selected RoutePath in the route path combo box. It is typically called after a user selects a route path from the combo box or adds a waypoint to the list manually.

      • showSelectedPathOnMap

        private void showSelectedPathOnMap()
        Gets the selected RoutePath from the route path combo box and highlights that route in the SystemMap;

      • newRoutePath

        private void newRoutePath()
        Adds a new RoutePath for the selected route and shows a corresponding RoutePathEdit dialog to edit it.

      • editRoutePath

        private void editRoutePath()
        Creates a RoutePathEdit dialog to edit the currently selected route path.

      • deleteRoutePath

        private void deleteRoutePath()
        Deletes the selected route path from the selected route in the SystemObjects database.
